medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp right lower quadrant abdominal pain for 12 hours.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started around midnight, was initially diffuse and gradually localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). It has persisted without improvement. The patient also reports nausea but no vomiting and feeling 'hot and cold' over the course of the night. There was a prior episode of RLQ abdominal pain approximately 3 months ago which self-resolved within 24 hours and was not as severe.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient has a history of omeprazole and lorazepam use as needed.
